Sunmi

Wonder Girls

Introduction

Sunmi is a South Korean singer and songwriter under ABYSS Company. She debuted in 2007 as a member of the South Korean girl group Wonder Girls and left the group in January 2010 to pursue an academic career.

After a three-year long hiatus from the music scene, Sunmi resumed her career as a soloist in August 2013 with her debut extended play Full Moon, which spawned the number two singles "24 Hours" and "Full Moon" on South Korea's Gaon Digital Chart.

In 2015, Sunmi was announced to be resuming promotion with the Wonder Girls until their disbandment in 2017. She subsequently left JYP Entertainment and eventually joined ABYSS Company.

In 2022, she started hosting the YouTube talk show, Showterview with Sunmi, after Jessi stepped down as host.

She was a dance mentor and a judge on a survival show "A2K" for episodes 21 and 22.
